data.title: ReFi Phangan Empowering Regenerative Future
data.description:
#### Towards a Sustainable Future with Regenerative Finance and Community Engagement

![Image](https://beige-defiant-spoonbill-537.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmenJAv55AUpnPwDVGCKkN8bXarNLnNW8kj4kAHdeAphZk)

### Our Mission

ReFi Phangan is dedicated to addressing environmental issues on Koh Phangan by fostering community engagement and leveraging web3 technologies to amplify our impact. We are spearheading a transformational approach to waste management on the island, which includes promoting sustainable practices among locals, tourists, and foreign residents, as well as establishing a full-circle plastic recycling facility.

### Our Achievements

In the past year, ReFi Phangan organized multiple cleanups, including monthly Earth Day events, Songkran and Labor Day, joint cleanups with the Clean Phangan community and a few unnamed individual cleanups. We held 6 Regen Full Moon events and several onboarding sessions, introducing over 100 residents to regenerative finance and sustainable practices. Additionally, we successfully onboarded the Clean Phangan community to web3 through the Impact Product - NFT collection by EcoSynthesisX, creating a new revenue stream for ongoing environmental efforts.

### Our Goals

**To Boost Community Onboarding and Education**

ReFi Phangan is a pioneer of regenerative finance on Koh Phangan, focusing on community building through onboarding events to introduce more local communities, NGOs, and individuals to web3 technologies and ReFi. Additionally, we aim to organize sustainability-focused events and mini-workshops in collaboration with existing activists on the island.

**To Expand Cleanups and Environmental Initiatives**

ReFi Phangan aims to increase the frequency and scale of cleanup activities on Koh Phangan by partnering with [Decentralized Cleanup Network](https://x.com/decentracleanup) and activating island community for DeCleanup Rewards program. This extra incentive and encouragement to participate in monthly cleanup will be a big step towards raising collective awareness about proper waste management among the residents. Eventually it will set up the scene for the next goal.

**Launching the Re:Plast Full Circle Recycling Facility**

Re:Plast is on a mission to turn the tide on plastic pollution in Koh Phangan by creating a local, self-sustaining recycling hub that transforms waste into opportunity. Our goal is to establish a fully operational recycling center, built on the proven Precious Plastic program, that empowers the local community to take control of their waste and create real environmental and economic impact.

This facility will not only divert significant amounts of plastic from landfills and ocean-bound waste streams, but it will also serve as an innovation space where discarded materials are reborn as valuable, eco-conscious products. Through hands-on workshops, educational outreach, and creative product design, Re:Plast will foster a new culture of sustainability on the island.

By collaborating with village leaders, local businesses, and sustainability advocates, we aim to embed recycling into the fabric of daily life ‚Äî making environmental responsibility both practical and locally driven. This project is more than just waste management; it‚Äôs a blueprint for a community-led circular economy that can be replicated elsewhere. 
Learn more about Re:Plast by clicking the image below:

[![Video Presentation](https://beige-defiant-spoonbill-537.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmVtHQanmkZMXagriRYaJzFKJ3Yzg5G9gexqypj36zjY5p)](https://beige-defiant-spoonbill-537.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmcFN8L46kcCG2AfmJV6JcQTbcM6LFfdByYeFPS8EuzgCK)

### Meet Our Team

**Paul Burg** - Co-Founder. 
Background: environmental scientist with experience in sustainability projects.

**Anastasia Lumina** - Co-Founder. 
Background: environmental activist and blockchain enthusiast.

**Juna Tollkuci** - Community Coordinator. 
Background: community events organizer with experience in environmental education and outreach.

### Join Us in Making a Difference

[![Image](https://beige-defiant-spoonbill-537.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmTP1eaJCmLTfgkjpTJBUGWRed321a316zhPNBBK1ni9KJ)](https://beige-defiant-spoonbill-537.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmTP1eaJCmLTfgkjpTJBUGWRed321a316zhPNBBK1ni9KJ)

ReFi Phangan is committed to driving positive change through innovative climate solutions and community engagement. By following regenerative finance principles and exposing the community to the innovative tools of web3, we aim to expand our initiatives, enhance our infrastructure, and deepen our impact, driving significant environmental and community benefits. Support us today for a better Koh Phangan future.
data.problem:
Koh Phangan, a beautiful island with a growing population of locals, tourists, and foreign residents, is facing significant environmental challenges due to improper waste management and a lack of sustainable practices. Despite the island‚Äôs natural beauty and ecological importance, the community has struggled to maintain a clean environment and to implement effective recycling solutions. 

The lack of a comprehensive waste management strategy, coupled with insufficient community engagement and awareness, has resulted in frequent pollution, littering, and an overwhelming amount of plastic waste. These issues not only degrade the island‚Äôs environment but also threaten the health and well-being of its inhabitants and the ecosystem. 

Without proper infrastructure and community involvement, these environmental problems will continue to escalate, undermining the island's potential for sustainable development and long-term ecological balance. Koh Phangan urgently needs innovative solutions that combine community-driven initiatives with modern technologies to address these pressing environmental issues effectively.
data.solution:
We are focusing our efforts on providing solutions through our clearly defined goals:

1. **Community Onboarding and Education:** By educating locals and NGOs about regenerative finance and sustainable practices, we empower the community to take an active role in environmental preservation.

2. **Expanded Cleanups:** Through partnerships like the Decentralized Cleanup Network, we are increasing the scale and frequency of cleanups, incentivizing participation, and promoting responsible waste management.

3. **Recycling Facility:** We are working towards establishing a recycling center that converts plastic waste into sustainable products, creating a circular economy and new income streams for the island.
data.missionSummary: ReFi Phangan's mission is to address Koh Phangan's environmental challenges by empowering the community through education, sustainable practices, and innovative web3 solutions.

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
Meetup with Baan Tai community and MEPLA (Marine Environment Preservation Longetivity Association) and establishing initial connections necessary for Re:Plast project implementation.
data.title: Initial meetup for Re:Plast

data.description: We actively participate in cleanups and support initiatives like Monthly Earth Day, Decentralized Cleanup (DCU), and Open Litter Map. Additionally, we are exploring partnerships with ReFi Tulum to amplify our impact.

data.description:
### Onboarding Events
We have organized 6 Regen Full Moon events in collaboration with GreenPill Phangan, focusing on introducing Phangan residents to crypto and regenerative mechanisms. These events include presentations on ReFi, deSci, and crypto for good, followed by eco-friendly dancing events. The goal of the events is to build networking and enhance coordination.
data.title: Onboarding Events

data.title: Re:Plast Facility Early Activation
data.description:
If the proposal to the Nouns ecosystem is approved, we will immediately move into the activation phase with the following key steps:

- Showcase & Community Visibility - announce the successful funding milestone across platforms to highlight Nouns' support and generate broader interest. This includes visual storytelling of the Re:Plast journey and a special focus on Nouns-aligned demo products to build resonance within the ecosystem.
- Test Zone Setup & Machine Installation - set up core Precious Plastic machines in a temporary or test location to begin small-batch recycling operations. This phase will serve as proof of concept and training ground for future scaling.
- Production of Demo Noggles - use recycled plastic to produce symbolic Nouns-themed products (e.g., Noggle-branded items), showcasing both technical capacity and brand alignment - a powerful marketing and validation tool.
- Community Activation & Local Buy-In - use demo production and public visibility to engage local stakeholders - from NGOs and schools to municipal bodies ‚Äî and attract interest from Thai-based impact investors and partners.
- Site Acquisition & Hiring of First Workers - with momentum and early proof in place and additional funding required from local supporters, proceed with formal site acquisition and recruitment of the first local staff to begin scaling full-circle operations.

data.title: Finalize proposal to Nouns ecosystem
data.description:
With a committed Thai-based lead confirmed, we are moving toward finalizing our funding proposal to the Nouns ecosystem. This proposal will enable us to secure the major funds needed to initiate setup of the Re:Plast full-circle facility, including ordering of key machinery for Precious Plastic operations, producing Noggles mold, final coordination with local stakeholders, signing permits and building brand awareness. This milestone will mark the transition from planning to execution, unlocking the ability to begin procurement, infrastructure setup, and local engagement at scale. The prop draft is ready on 80%, full budget of Phase 1 isn't finalized at this point. 

[Phase 1 Prop Draft ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/12f0l56Kks0v1UhEzPDY-PuL5jhFKLUmLOCopgVvUaOM/edit?usp=sharing)- feel free to view and comment. The idea already received positive feedback on the Nouncil call on Discord.

data.title: Campaign to find local Thai lead for Re:Plast
data.description: This milestone was included in our roadmap six months ago, but it has not been achieved due to a key challenge: we have not yet identified a suitable Thai-based leader to take ownership of the project locally and didn't gather initial funding needed to begin project implementation. Over the past months, our efforts were primarily focused on structuring the overall framework and addressing foundational tasks, which limited our capacity to prioritize recruitment. Additionally, the search for the right person has proven difficult - we require someone with both local knowledge and commitment to the project‚Äôs long-term vision, and this combination has been hard to find. Without this leadership in place and funding secured so we can start giving out the salary for this project manager, we cannot proceed due to regulatory and operational constraints.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

With a committed Thai-based lead confirmed, we are moving toward finalizing our funding proposal to the Nouns ecosystem. This proposal will enable us to secure the major funds needed to initiate setup of the Re:Plast full-circle facility, including ordering of key machinery for Precious Plastic operations, producing Noggles mold, final coordination with local stakeholders, signing permits and building brand awareness. milestones.title: Re:Plast Facility Early Activation
milestones.description:
If the proposal to the Nouns ecosystem is approved, we will immediately move into the activation phase with the following key steps:

- Showcase & Community Visibility - announce the successful funding milestone across platforms to highlight Nouns' support and generate broader interest. This includes visual storytelling of the Re:Plast journey and a special focus on Nouns-aligned demo products to build resonance within the ecosystem.
- Test Zone Setup & Machine Installation - set up core Precious Plastic machines in a temporary or test location to begin small-batch recycling operations. This phase will serve as proof of concept and training ground for future scaling.
- Production of Demo Noggles - use recycled plastic to produce symbolic Nouns-themed products (e.g., Noggle-branded items), showcasing both technical capacity and brand alignment - a powerful marketing and validation tool.
- Community Activation & Local Buy-In - use demo production and public visibility to engage local stakeholders - from NGOs and schools to municipal bodies ‚Äî and attract interest from Thai-based impact investors and partners.
- Site Acquisition & Hiring of First Workers
With momentum and early proof in place and additional funding required from local supporters, proceed with formal site acquisition and recruitment of the first local staff to begin scaling full-circle operations.

Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
